docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. government has suspended new enrollment in Cigna’s Medicare Advantage health insurance and drug plans, saying Cigna had “widespread and systemic failures.”

headline.main: U.S. Government Suspends Enrollment in Cigna Medicare Advantage
headline.print_headline: U.S. Government Suspends Enrollment in Cigna Medicare Advantage, Drug Plans

docs.snippet: The U.S. government has suspended new enrollment in Cigna’s Medicare Advantage health insurance and drug plans, saying Cigna had “widespread and systemic failures.”

docs.lead_paragraph: Exploring the details of how Bernie Sanders’s single-payer health plan would be paid for.

headline.main: Sanders Makes a Rare Pitch: More Taxes for More Government
headline.print_headline: Sanders’s Pitch: More Taxes for More Government

docs.abstract: The Upshot; Sen Bernie Sanders has proposed health care plan that relies on idea that has long been unfashionable in United States, namely that all Americans should pay higher taxes to pay for new, expensive health care service from federal government that requires no deductibles or co-pays; key to Sanders's argument is that his plan substitutes high fees citizens pay to health insurers with taxes.
docs.snippet: Exploring the details of how Bernie Sanders’s single-payer health plan would be paid for.

docs.lead_paragraph: Idealism is nice, but it’s not a virtue without tough minded realism.
docs.abstract: Paul Krugman Op-Ed column argues both Democrats and Republicans are laboring under idea that radical agenda, if presented compellingly enough, will be embraced by American voters; holds political pragmatism is needed to enact change, and idealism is not virtue unless paired with realism; warns brand of idealism espoused by Bernie Sanders may not ultimately be effective.
docs.snippet: Idealism is nice, but it’s not a virtue without tough minded realism.

docs.lead_paragraph: Civil rights advocates say that the Michigan city’s health crisis smacks of the kind of discrimination that causes the disproportionate exposure of blacks to polluted air, water and soil.

headline.main: A Question of Environmental Racism in Flint
headline.print_headline: A Question of Environmental Racism in Flint

docs.abstract: Civil rights advocates say Michigan's slow and testy response to lead-polluted water in Flint, which is mainly poor and black, is due to environmental racism; city has little political power, as blacks comprise 14 percent of Michigan's population, and state government is Republican-controlled.
docs.snippet: Civil rights advocates say that the Michigan city’s health crisis smacks of the kind of discrimination that causes the disproportionate exposure of blacks to polluted air, water and soil.

byline.contributor: Mitch Smith contributed reporting from Chicago.

docs.lead_paragraph: Twelve of the 23 health insurance cooperatives set up with $2.5 billion in federal funding have shut down, rather than spur competition as intended.

headline.main: Republicans Say Government Mismanaged Health Care Co-ops
headline.print_headline: ‘Red Flags’ Missed on Health Co-ops, Republicans Say

docs.abstract: Group of Republican senators, during hearing of Senate Finance Committee, accuse Obama administration of failing to heed financial warning signs at nonprofit health insurance cooperatives that ultimately failed in 2015; Andrew M Slavitt, acting administrator at Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services, disputes accusation; administration's hope was that co-ops would create greater competition in state insurance markets.
docs.snippet: Twelve of the 23 health insurance cooperatives set up with $2.5 billion in federal funding have shut down, rather than spur competition as intended.

keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Readers take issue with Paul Krugman, who argued that a “single-payer system just isn’t going to happen” so we need to focus on fixing Obamacare.

headline.main: Is a Single-Payer Health Insurance Program Feasible?

docs.snippet: Readers take issue with Paul Krugman, who argued that a “single-payer system just isn’t going to happen” so we need to focus on fixing Obamacare.
